clinical_study.brief_title: Concentration-Controlled Ribavirin for the Treatment of Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Concentration-Controlled Ribavirin for the Treatment of Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if concentration-controlled ribavirin dosing can achieve a targeted level of plasma exposures and if it appears safe and effective compared with standard weight-based ribavirin dosing. Forty, previously treatment-naive participants with genotype 1 disease will be randomized to receive concentration-guided or standard weight-based ribavirin. Peginterferon alfa 2a,ribavirin, and telaprevir will be provided through the study.

primary_outcome.description: Demonstrate that concentration-controlled ribavirin dosing can achieve a targeted level of plasma exposure with reduced variability in the steady-state area-under-the-concentration-time curve (AUC0-12) compared with standard weight-based ribavirin dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: efficacy - early and sustained virologic response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: EVR (12 weeks) and SVR (24 wks after cessation of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Compare proportions with EVR and SVR in standard weight-based vs. concentration-guided ribavirin dosing groups

arm_group.description: 1000 mg daily in patients weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg daily in patients weighing ≥ 75 kg
Dose adjusted based on first dose AUC0-12

intervention.description: Randomization to standard weight based ribavirin dosing (1000 or 1200 mg daily) or concentration-guided dosing based on first dose AUC0-12
